title: Practice Challenge
description:
Simulate a Hono server ready for multi-platform deployment:

1. Create a `honoApp` object that:
   - Has routes for /, /health, and /api/users
   - Shows which platform it's running on
   - Demonstrates Hono's response helpers (c.text, c.json)

2. Simulate deploying to different platforms (Bun, Workers, Deno)
instructions:
Simulate a Hono server ready for multi-platform deployment:

1. Create a `honoApp` object that:
   - Has routes for /, /health, and /api/users
   - Shows which platform it's running on
   - Demonstrates Hono's response helpers (c.text, c.json)

2. Simulate deploying to different platforms (Bun, Workers, Deno)

testCases.description: Should handle requests on multiple platforms

hints.text: Hono uses c.text(), c.json(), c.html() for responses - the same API works everywhere!

commonMistakes.consequence: Bun and Cloudflare Workers need export default app to serve the application.
Bun.env only exists in Bun runtime, causing errors on Cloudflare Workers.
commonMistakes.correction: Use process.env which works everywhere, or check the runtime first.

commonMistakes.consequence: import { Hono } from 'hono' won't work in Deno without npm: prefix.
